materials.raw_text: Co: 16 g, Mn: 4 g, Nd: 3 g, P: 12 g, Tm: 1 g

sourcing.instructions: Co (Cobalt): Specialty metal suppliers or online chemical vendors; Mn (Manganese): Chemical supply stores; Nd (Neodymium): Rare earth metal suppliers; P (Phosphorus): Chemical supply stores; Tm (Thulium): Rare earth metal suppliers.
steps: Co (Cobalt): Specialty metal suppliers or online chemical vendors; Mn (Manganese): Chemical supply stores; Nd (Neodymium): Rare earth metal suppliers; P (Phosphorus): Chemical supply stores; Tm (Thulium): Rare earth metal suppliers.

1. Measure the exact amounts of each ingredient using a precision scale. 2. In a clean, dry container, combine the Co, Mn, Nd, P, and Tm powders. 3. Stir the mixture thoroughly using a spatula until uniformly blended.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Measure the exact amounts of each ingredient using a precision scale. 2. In a clean, dry container, combine the Co, Mn, Nd, P, and Tm powders. 3. Stir the mixture thoroughly using a spatula until uniformly blended.

steps: 1. Transfer the mixed powder into a crucible. 2. Place the crucible in a furnace. 3. Heat to 1200°C at a rate of 10°C per minute. 4. Maintain temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete melting and mixing of ingredients.
heating.raw_text: 1. Transfer the mixed powder into a crucible. 2. Place the crucible in a furnace. 3. Heat to 1200°C at a rate of 10°C per minute. 4. Maintain temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete melting and mixing of ingredients.

steps: 1. Once the heating duration is complete, turn off the furnace. 2. Allow the crucible to cool slowly to room temperature (approximately 25°C) over 4-6 hours to prevent cracking.
cooling.raw_text: 1. Once the heating duration is complete, turn off the furnace. 2. Allow the crucible to cool slowly to room temperature (approximately 25°C) over 4-6 hours to prevent cracking.

steps: 1. Remove the solidified sample from the crucible. 2. Use a diamond saw to cut it to final dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches. 3. Sand the edges and surfaces with fine-grit sandpaper to achieve a smooth finish. 4. Optionally, apply a protective sealant to enhance durability.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Remove the solidified sample from the crucible. 2. Use a diamond saw to cut it to final dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches. 3. Sand the edges and surfaces with fine-grit sandpaper to achieve a smooth finish. 4. Optionally, apply a protective sealant to enhance durability.
